sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces continue to fight back against the Russian invasion, but the human cost has been high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But Ukrainian artillery units are continuing to fight back on Russian positions with whatever weapons they have, including grab multiple rocket launchers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But the cost has been high. Hundreds of recent graves can be seen outside Mariupol. Some are empty. The Ukrainian authorities have been digging them since the Russian military operation started in February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The German newspaper Bild am Sonntag reported on Sunday that Chancellor Olaf Scholz, French President Emmanuel Macron and Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi will all visit Ukraine before the G7 meets at the end of June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But none of the leaders have yet confirmed that the visit will go ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky continues to argue that Ukraine should be allowed to join the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Zelensky continues to argue that Ukraine should be allowed to join the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I am sure that we will soon receive an answer on the status of a candidate for Ukraine, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I am convinced that this decision can strengthen not only our state, but the entire European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And just what else needs to happen in Europe to make it clear to sceptics that the very fact of keeping Ukraine outside the European Union works against Europe.
